data.title: Robot tracking app
data.solution:
y,x = map(int, input().split())
n = int(input())
for i in range(n) :
    heading = input()
    y = y - (heading=='n')*(1-2*(y==0)) + (heading == 's')*(1-2*(y==9))
    x = x - (heading=='w')*(1-2*(x==0)) + (heading == 'e')*(1-2*(x==9))
print(f'{y} {x}')
data.statement:
You are tracking a robot in an empty room. The room is a grid of {{10}} by {{10}} units. The north west corner is {{0 0}} and the south west corner is {{9 0}}. The robot gives you its heading each second (can be facing north, south, east, west).
The robot moves forward at one unit per second unless it would hit a wall in which case it goes backward instead.
Given a starting point and a sequence of headings, output the final position of the robot.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are tracking a robot in an empty room. The room is a grid of 10 by 10 units. The north west corner is 0 0 and the south west corner is 9 0. The robot gives you its heading each second (can be facing north, south, east, west).
The robot moves forward at one unit per second unless it would hit a wall in which case it goes backward instead.
Given a starting point and a sequence of headings, output the final position of the robot.
Input
Line 1 The starting position y and x, two integers separated by a blank space
Line 2 An integer n for the number of headings
Next n lines heading h among [n s e w], representing north, south, east and west respectively
Output
The final position, two numbers separated by a blank space.
Constraints
0<=y<=9
0<=x<=9
0<n
Example
Input
4 6
5
n
w
w
s
e
Output
4 5
